channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: “I expected a write-up. I did not expect to get terminated. I cried the entire way home.” https://t.co/WNZeSeZFKq
Breaking News: A Texas court halted the state from investigating parents of transgender children for abuse, ruling that the policy was improperly adopted. https://t.co/Sqg8vmhGNA

Pixar has a reputation for films focused on and written by men. But its latest movie, "Turning Red," bucks that trend: an unabashedly female story directed by Domee Shi, the first woman in the studio's 36-year history to be in charge of a feature. https://t.co/1KFqqz4aql

Prominent conservative voices have mischaracterized remarks from U.S. officials to amplify baseless claims about Ukrainian bioweapons labs that Russian state media have promoted. The White House, Pentagon, and State Department have denied the claims. https://t.co/eeoGBdpPdI https://t.co/Y0vSWnh9Lq

The U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, slammed Russia for using the Security Council to spread disinformation and legitimize its invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/u8RiWdMpFp https://t.co/fwgMQ9AbOS

Ukraine's vast array of historic buildings, priceless artworks and public squares are an integral part of the country's cultural identity. Amid the violence of war, many are being reduced to rubble. https://t.co/xA4w5pcS7c https://t.co/CVdIwFs3oZ

Vice President Kamala Harris said the inflated costs in the U.S. were worth paying to penalize Russia over its invasion of Ukraine: “There is a price to pay for democracy,” adding that it is important to “stand with your friends,” she said. https://t.co/iSH3EbWD2W https://t.co/m42wcLzWqB

Oxxxymiron, also known as Miron Fyodorov, one of Russia's most popular rappers, announced a series of anti-war charity concerts, which will happen outside Russia because of "total censorship." The shows' proceeds will help those fleeing Ukraine, he said. https://t.co/SDPhrqPRCn

Three Ukrainian soldiers killed in combat were buried in Lviv on Friday, as civilian and military casualties keep rising in the war against Russia. Elsewhere, the rumble of heavy artillery fire echoed across Kyiv as Russian forces renewed their offensive. https://t.co/2i2h1FmDkP https://t.co/lpGj4bg5fc

At least three people were killed in a Russian missile strike on a maternity hospital in Mariupol, Ukrainian officials said. People are cutting down trees for fuel and digging mass graves in the city, which has been encircled by Russian troops. https://t.co/pKGvJMBsmB https://t.co/GRm0l3ZFcT
President Biden is betting that Americans are willing to endure the financial pain that comes from waging an economic war with Russia. https://t.co/awddNyeszU

The Russian authorities started the process of banning Instagram in the country. They also opened a criminal case against Meta, Instagram’s parent company, asking a court to declare it an “extremist organization.”
Follow our updates on Ukraine. https://t.co/J8tpNnfXv6

Kyrylo Lysov, 22, and his girlfriend Yelyzaveta Sokolova, 20, shared a last moment together at the train station in Lviv. As refugees flee Ukraine, men between the ages of 18 and 60 are forbidden to leave, and many, like Lysov, are staying to fight. https://t.co/y2w72QEivB https://t.co/rLnVxINwoi

At least two million Ukrainians have fled Russia’s invasion. Amid sanctions and a clampdown on dissent, Russians, too, have been pouring out of their country in recent weeks.
But a Russian exodus to the U.S. was already well underway before the war. https://t.co/Rpwqt7LgNs https://t.co/hJlghX8QvD

The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol ran into a familiar roadblock on Thursday as Michael Flynn invoked his right against self-incrimination rather than answer questions about the events that led to a mob assault on Congress. https://t.co/ccpmQDNXtX

Ukraine accused President Vladimir Putin of ordering “the preparation of a terrorist attack” at the defunct Chernobyl nuclear plant, claiming Russian saboteurs had entered the facility posing as electrical repair workers. https://t.co/3jKqqeUS94

Videos and photographs verified by The New York Times show apparent bombings on Friday morning of three Ukrainian cities that until now had not sustained major attacks: Dnipro, Lutsk and Ivano-Frankivsk. https://t.co/YzX76aT2h6

Beijing says it will maintain economic ties with Moscow, possibly offering a financial lifeline to Russia in the face of Western sanctions. There is just one big problem: money. Specifically, China’s money. https://t.co/4pCoQuc73X

The death of Officer Jeffrey Smith, who killed himself nine days after confronting a mob at the Capitol on Jan. 6, was the direct result of an injury he sustained during the riot, a retirement board has found. https://t.co/2egYHLYHfk

Firefighters rescued a woman from the rubble in Mariupol, Ukraine, as Russian forces continued their siege of the port city. A man towing his possessions behind him said a mortar shell had destroyed his home. https://t.co/ZmyQphwEo7 https://t.co/rotp9ue5Me

President Biden on Friday will announce that the U.S. will join the G7 and the EU in calling for the suspension of normal trade relations with Russia, according to a person familiar with the announcement. https://t.co/azpoyGvx4p

The International Atomic Energy Agency warned of “deteriorating and exhausting conditions” for staff at the defunct Chernobyl nuclear power plant in Ukraine. It said workers “have not been able to rotate since the day before Russian forces took control.” https://t.co/04PVOITslZ
Breaking News: The Senate approved a $1.5 trillion federal spending bill, including billions in aid for Ukraine. President Biden is expected to sign it. https://t.co/dn6Z45wYwK

South Korea has elected a new president.
Yoon Suk-yeol, a prosecutor turned conservative opposition leader, won an extremely close election with calls for a more confrontational stance against North Korea and a stronger alliance with the U.S. https://t.co/qyj8KwHJpi https://t.co/BLRhEHdCBh
The White House warned that false claims about the war in Ukraine by both Moscow and Beijing may provide cover for Russian operations. https://t.co/gQD3MX8i3X

Kyrylo Lysov, 22, and his girlfriend Yelyzaveta Sokolova, 20, shared a last moment together at the train station in Lviv. As refugees flee Ukraine, men between the ages of 18 and 60 are forbidden to leave, and many, like Lysov, are staying to fight. https://t.co/ca247VJJJs https://t.co/Ae9vMne6Tu

A Black manager of a Dunkin’ shop in Tampa, Florida, who fatally punched a 77-year-old white customer last year after he repeatedly used a racial slur in addressing him was sentenced this week to two years of house arrest, prosecutors said. https://t.co/kA1xSzipGo

Emilio Delgado, the actor who for more than four decades played Luis on the beloved children’s television show “Sesame Street,” died on Thursday at his home in New York City. He was 81. https://t.co/QSWdqlzs1R

The primary reason for rising gas prices over the past year is the coronavirus pandemic and its disruptions to global supply and demand. It's not because of the Biden administration’s policies on the Keystone XL pipeline, as some Republicans claim. https://t.co/4ftJyzBQzX

"I told myself, ‘Either I watch the war on Facebook and write in comments and cry, or I go and help.’” A growing number of Ukrainians in the U.S., many of whom have never fired a weapon, are joining the fight against Russia. https://t.co/tWz1oeoSTx https://t.co/H1jG8NpnbO

Russian forces have continued their siege of Mariupol, a day after bombing a maternity hospital in the city. Most communications are cut off, people are struggling to find food and water, and the authorities have been burying the dead in mass graves. https://t.co/UFaLGoyNgG https://t.co/T60dzxoJtR

Russia should "absolutely" be investigated for war crimes in Ukraine, Vice President Kamala Harris said on Thursday. "I have no question the eyes of the world are on this war and what Russia has done in terms of this aggression and these atrocities." https://t.co/mN5XYU8y2C https://t.co/Dai9m35WSj

Some Ukrainian families are holding funerals for fallen relatives. In Kyiv, Yelena Lavinska, 22, was surrounded by friends, relatives and comrades of her fiancé, Mikhailo Pristupa, a Ukrainian soldier who was shot and killed in combat on Saturday in Irpin. https://t.co/OPWyg2wr0r https://t.co/CwxNfdy0y4

The Ukrainian delegation at the Winter Paralympic Games in China held a demonstration for peace at the athletes’ village on Thursday. The group unfurled a banner appealing for peace and observed a minute of silence in response to Russia’s invasion. https://t.co/KxtlSb9hrg https://t.co/JWyelrZcwb
Breaking News: The 2020 census undercounted the U.S. population by 18.8 million and underrepresented Black, Latino and Indigenous people, officials said. https://t.co/s2p3LhTjvK
The primary reason for rising gas prices is the pandemic and its disruptions to global supply and demand. Not President Biden's policies, as Republicans claim. https://t.co/pLKd6tdvIu

What are the books that changed your life? The writer @alexanderchee joins @heyitsfranklin2 and @lachristensen from @nytimesbooks to discuss the books that made them who they are. Join us now. https://t.co/hDItJXV2p3 https://t.co/6IRkAepMOF

Britain froze the assets of Roman Abramovich, the Russian owner of Chelsea F.C., effectively blocking the soccer team’s proposed sale. The team was granted a special license to keep operating but cannot sell tickets or merchandise. https://t.co/93pdSzoe1G https://t.co/nlkeUbBKGv

Goldman Sachs is pulling out of Russia, becoming the first major American bank to exit the country after Western governments imposed a raft of sanctions intended to cripple the Russian economy. https://t.co/UOqtE2Sw4a

Russia has destroyed $100 billion worth of Ukrainian assets since it invaded, an economic adviser to the Ukrainian government said.
He called for a global embargo on Russian oil and gas, describing payments for Russia’s energy products as “blood money.” https://t.co/Bo4m05mCpJ

Scotland apologized for the historical persecution of nearly 4,000 people accused of witchcraft, a vast majority of them women.
“It was injustice on a colossal scale,” Nicola Sturgeon, the first minister of Scotland, said. https://t.co/WjzlTKTbEn https://t.co/Xz2gbY5kRU

Tetiana Perebyinis and her two children were killed trying to dash to safety, a moment captured by a New York Times photographer. Her husband describes their lives, and their final hours. https://t.co/RDpOznwcJ8 https://t.co/ueGd3csXsJ

The area in front of the Russian Embassy in Oslo didn’t really have a name — until officials gave it one: Ukraine’s Square.
Many European cities are changing the addresses of Russian embassies, giving them names with a pro-Ukraine theme. https://t.co/XrEGZu3ifl

Nicola Sturgeon, the first minister of Scotland, apologized for the country’s persecution of nearly 4,000 people, the vast majority of them women, who were accused of witchcraft centuries ago. “It was injustice on a colossal scale,” she said. https://t.co/WeO7kvjOeP
President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine has accused Russia of carrying out a genocide. https://t.co/CJ3ZUxzm6p https://t.co/X4KouhJ0Sd

Breaking News: Britain froze the assets of Roman Abramovich, the Russian owner of Chelsea F.C., effectively blocking the soccer team’s proposed sale. The team was granted a special license to keep operating but cannot sell tickets or merchandise. https://t.co/tZzxfh0Tz6

A Black manager of a Dunkin’ shop in Tampa, Florida, who fatally punched a 77-year-old white customer last year after he repeatedly used a racial slur in addressing him was sentenced this week to two years of house arrest, prosecutors said. https://t.co/XsbM6rvR2X

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine has accused Russia of carrying out a genocide.
"The air bomb on the maternity hospital is the final proof. Proof that the genocide of Ukrainians is taking place," he said in a speech. https://t.co/hf178n0jJd

In the final years of Donald Trump’s presidency, Republicans characterized Ukraine as run by nefarious oligarchs and unlawful politicians, a bad actor trying to tamper in U.S. elections. That portrayal has dramatically changed amid Russia’s invasion. https://t.co/yioFgr28Sf

"We have made polar history." Explorers and researchers, battling freezing temperatures, have located Endurance, Ernest Shackleton’s ship that sank in the Antarctic in 1915. https://t.co/EVBhJJ5StD https://t.co/B8fjckUwpp
